member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary:
The SECURITY_INFORMATION data type identifies the object-related security information being set or queried. This security information includes:
The owner of an object
The primary group of an object
The discretionary access control list (DACL) of an object
The system access control list (SACL) of an object

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.OWNER_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The owner identifier of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.GROUP_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The primary group identifier of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.DACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The DACL of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.SACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The SACL of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.LABEL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The mandatory integrity label is being referenced. The mandatory integrity label is an ACE in the SACL of the object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.ATTRIBUTE_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The resource properties of the object being referenced. The resource properties are stored in SYSTEM_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_ACE types in the SACL of the security descriptor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.SCOPE_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The Central Access Policy (CAP) identifier applicable on the object that is being referenced. Each CAP identifier is stored in a SYSTEM_SCOPED_POLICY_ID_ACE type in the SACL of the SD.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.PROCESS_TRUST_LABEL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.BACKUP_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: All parts of the security descriptor. This is useful for backup and restore software that needs to preserve the entire security descriptor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.PROTECTED_DACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The DACL cannot inherit access control entries (ACEs).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.PROTECTED_SACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The SACL cannot inherit ACEs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.UNPROTECTED_DACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The DACL inherits ACEs from the parent object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_INFORMATION.UNPROTECTED_SACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The SACL inherits ACEs from the parent object.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT
member.summary:
CLIPFORMAT is a 2-byte value representing a clipboard format.
This cannot be used as a drop-in replacement for many of the winuser.h function as they expect a 4-byte value. However, this can automatically convert between the 4-byte values and the 2-byte value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_BITMAP
member.summary: A handle to a bitmap (HBITMAP).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DIB
member.summary: A memory object containing a BITMAPINFO structure followed by the bitmap bits.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DIBV5
member.summary: A memory object containing a BITMAPV5HEADER structure followed by the bitmap color space information and the bitmap bits.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DIF
member.summary: Software Arts' Data Interchange Format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DSPBITMAP
member.summary: Bitmap display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in bitmap format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DSPENHMETAFILE
member.summary: Enhanced metafile display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in enhanced metafile format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DSPMETAFILEPICT
member.summary: Metafile-picture display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in metafile-picture format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_DSPTEXT
member.summary: Text display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in text format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_ENHMETAFILE
member.summary: A handle to an enhanced metafile (HENHMETAFILE).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_GDIOBJFIRST
member.summary:
Start of a range of integer values for application-defined GDI object clipboard formats. The end of the range is CF_GDIOBJLAST.
Handles associated with clipboard formats in this range are not automatically deleted using the GlobalFree function when the clipboard is emptied. Also, when using values in this range, the hMem parameter is not a handle to a GDI object, but is a handle allocated by the GlobalAlloc function with the GMEM_MOVEABLE flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_GDIOBJLAST
member.summary: See CF_GDIOBJFIRST.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_HDROP
member.summary: A handle to type HDROP that identifies a list of files. An application can retrieve information about the files by passing the handle to the DragQueryFile function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_LOCALE
member.summary:
The data is a handle to the locale identifier associated with text in the clipboard. When you close the clipboard, if it contains CF_TEXT data but no CF_LOCALE data, the system automatically sets the CF_LOCALE format to the current input language. You can use the CF_LOCALE format to associate a different locale with the clipboard text.
An application that pastes text from the clipboard can retrieve this format to determine which character set was used to generate the text.
Note that the clipboard does not support plain text in multiple character sets. To achieve this, use a formatted text data type such as RTF instead.
The system uses the code page associated with CF_LOCALE to implicitly convert from CF_TEXT to CF_UNICODETEXT. Therefore, the correct code page table is used for the conversion.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_METAFILEPICT
member.summary: Handle to a metafile picture format as defined by the METAFILEPICT structure. When passing a CF_METAFILEPICT handle by means of DDE, the application responsible for deleting hMem should also free the metafile referred to by the CF_METAFILEPICT handle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_OEMTEXT
member.summary: Text format containing characters in the OEM character set. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_OWNERDISPLAY
member.summary: Owner-display format. The clipboard owner must display and update the clipboard viewer window, and receive the WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME, WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD, WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD, WM_SIZECLIPBOARD, and WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD messages. The hMem parameter must be NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_PALETTE
member.summary:
Handle to a color palette. Whenever an application places data in the clipboard that depends on or assumes a color palette, it should place the palette on the clipboard as well.
If the clipboard contains data in the CF_PALETTE (logical color palette) format, the application should use the SelectPalette and RealizePalette functions to realize (compare) any other data in the clipboard against that logical palette.
When displaying clipboard data, the clipboard always uses as its current palette any object on the clipboard that is in the CF_PALETTE format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_PENDATA
member.summary: Data for the pen extensions to the Microsoft Windows for Pen Computing.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_PRIVATEFIRST
member.summary: Start of a range of integer values for private clipboard formats. The range ends with CF_PRIVATELAST. Handles associated with private clipboard formats are not freed automatically; the clipboard owner must free such handles, typically in response to the WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_PRIVATELAST
member.summary: See CF_PRIVATEFIRST.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_RIFF
member.summary: Represents audio data more complex than can be represented in a CF_WAVE standard wave format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_SYLK
member.summary: Microsoft Symbolic Link (SYLK) format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_TEXT
member.summary: Text format. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data. Use this format for ANSI text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_TIFF
member.summary: Tagged-image file format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_UNICODETEXT
member.summary: Unicode text format. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.CLIPFORMAT.CF_WAVE
member.summary: Represents audio data in one of the standard wave formats, such as 11 kHz or 22 kHz PCM.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags
member.summary: The formatting options for DrawText.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_TOP
member.summary: Justifies the text to the top of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_LEFT
member.summary: Aligns text to the left.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_CENTER
member.summary: Centers text horizontally in the rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_RIGHT
member.summary: Aligns text to the right.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_VCENTER
member.summary: Centers text vertically. This value is used only with the DT_SINGLELINE value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_BOTTOM
member.summary: Justifies the text to the bottom of the rectangle. This value is used only with the DT_SINGLELINE value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_WORDBREAK
member.summary: Breaks words. Lines are automatically broken between words if a word extends past the edge of the rectangle specified by the lprc parameter. A carriage return-line feed sequence also breaks the line.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_SINGLELINE
member.summary: Displays text on a single line only. Carriage returns and line feeds do not break the line.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_EXPANDTABS
member.summary: Expands tab characters. The default number of characters per tab is eight.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_TABSTOP
member.summary: Sets tab stops. The DRAWTEXTPARAMS structure pointed to by the lpDTParams parameter specifies the number of average character widths per tab stop.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_NOCLIP
member.summary: Draws without clipping. DrawTextEx is somewhat faster when DT_NOCLIP is used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_EXTERNALLEADING
member.summary: Includes the font external leading in line height. Normally, external leading is not included in the height of a line of text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_CALCRECT
member.summary: Determines the width and height of the rectangle. If there are multiple lines of text, DrawTextEx uses the width of the rectangle pointed to by the lprc parameter and extends the base of the rectangle to bound the last line of text. If there is only one line of text, DrawTextEx modifies the right side of the rectangle so that it bounds the last character in the line. In either case, DrawTextEx returns the height of the formatted text, but does not draw the text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_NOPREFIX
member.summary: Turns off processing of prefix characters. Normally, DrawTextEx interprets the ampersand (&) mnemonic-prefix character as a directive to underscore the character that follows, and the double-ampersand (&&) mnemonic-prefix characters as a directive to print a single ampersand. By specifying DT_NOPREFIX, this processing is turned off. Compare with DT_HIDEPREFIX and DT_PREFIXONLY

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_INTERNAL
member.summary: Uses the system font to calculate text metrics.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_EDITCONTROL
member.summary: Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control. Specifically, the average character width is calculated in the same manner as for an edit control, and the function does not display a partially visible last line.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS
member.summary: For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle. If the string contains backslash (\) characters, DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash. The string is not modified unless the DT_MODIFYSTRING flag is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_END_ELLIPSIS
member.summary: For displayed text, replaces the end of a string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle. Any word (not at the end of the string) that goes beyond the limits of the rectangle is truncated without ellipses. The string is not modified unless the DT_MODIFYSTRING flag is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_MODIFYSTRING
member.summary: Modifies the specified string to match the displayed text. This value has no effect unless DT_END_ELLIPSIS or DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_RTLREADING
member.summary: Layout in right-to-left reading order for bidirectional text when the font selected into the hdc is a Hebrew or Arabic font. The default reading order for all text is left-to-right.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_WORD_ELLIPSIS
member.summary: Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_NOFULLWIDTHCHARBREAK
member.summary: Prevents a line break at a DBCS (double-wide character string), so that the line-breaking rule is equivalent to SBCS strings. For example, this can be used in Korean windows, for more readability of icon labels. This value has no effect unless DT_WORDBREAK is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_HIDEPREFIX
member.summary: Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text. The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags.DT_PREFIXONLY
member.summary: Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character. Does not draw any character in the string.

member.param: A number that is a power of 2 (e.g. 2, 4, 8, 16, ...).
member.returns: A value that is aligned to the next multiple of . This value may be the same as .

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand
member.summary: The flags that specify how an application is to be displayed when it is opened.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_NORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. The active window remains active.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the z-order.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. The active window remains active.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current state. The active window remains active.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ flag specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application. An application should call ShowWindow with this flag to set the initial show state of its main window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ShowWindowCommand.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex
member.summary: Color index used to get a system color from GetSysColor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_SCROLLBAR
member.summary: Scroll bar gray area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_BACKGROUND
member.summary: Desktop.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_ACTIVECAPTION
member.summary: Active window title bar. The associated foreground color is COLOR_CAPTIONTEXT. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_INACTIVECAPTION
member.summary: Inactive window caption. The associated foreground color is COLOR_INACTIVECAPTIONTEXT. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_MENU
member.summary: Menu background. The associated foreground color is COLOR_MENUTEXT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_WINDOW
member.summary: Window background. The associated foreground colors are COLOR_WINDOWTEXT and COLOR_HOTLITE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_WINDOWFRAME
member.summary: Window frame.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_MENUTEXT
member.summary: Text in menus. The associated background color is COLOR_MENU.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_WINDOWTEXT
member.summary: Text in windows. The associated background color is COLOR_WINDOW.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_CAPTIONTEXT
member.summary: Text in caption, size box, and scroll bar arrow box. The associated background color is COLOR_ACTIVECAPTION.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_ACTIVEBORDER
member.summary: Active window border.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_INACTIVEBORDER
member.summary: Inactive window border.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_APPWORKSPACE
member.summary: Background color of multiple document interface (MDI) applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_HIGHLIGHT
member.summary: Item(s) selected in a control. The associated foreground color is COLOR_HIGHLIGHTTEXT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_HIGHLIGHTTEXT
member.summary: Text of item(s) selected in a control. The associated background color is COLOR_HIGHLIGHT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_BTNFACE
member.summary: Face color for three-dimensional display elements and for dialog box backgrounds. The associated foreground color is COLOR_BTNTEXT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_BTNSHADOW
member.summary: Shadow color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing away from the light source).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_GRAYTEXT
member.summary: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to 0 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_BTNTEXT
member.summary: Text on push buttons. The associated background color is COLOR_BTNFACE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_INACTIVECAPTIONTEXT
member.summary: Inactive window caption. The associated foreground color is COLOR_INACTIVECAPTIONTEXT. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_BTNHIGHLIGHT
member.summary: Highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_3DDKSHADOW
member.summary: Dark shadow for three-dimensional display elements.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_3DLIGHT
member.summary: Light color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_INFOTEXT
member.summary: Text color for tooltip controls. The associated background color is COLOR_INFOBK.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_INFOBK
member.summary: Background color for tooltip controls. The associated foreground color is COLOR_INFOTEXT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_HOTLIGHT
member.summary: Item(s) selected in a control. The associated foreground color is COLOR_HIGHLIGHTTEXT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_GRADIENTACTIVECAPTION
member.summary: Right side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar. COLOR_ACTIVECAPTION specifies the left side color. Use SPI_GETGRADIENTCAPTIONS with the SystemParametersInfo function to determine whether the gradient effect is enabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_GRADIENTINACTIVECAPTION
member.summary: Right side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar. COLOR_INACTIVECAPTION specifies the left side color.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_MENUHILIGHT
member.summary: The color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu (see SystemParametersInfo). The highlighted menu item is outlined with COLOR_HIGHLIGHT. Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_MENUBAR
member.summary: The background color for the menu bar when menus appear as flat menus (see SystemParametersInfo). However, COLOR_MENU continues to specify the background color of the menu popup. Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_DESKTOP
member.summary: Desktop.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_3DFACE
member.summary: Face color for three-dimensional display elements and for dialog box backgrounds.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_3DSHADOW
member.summary: Shadow color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing away from the light source).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_3DHIGHLIGHT
member.summary: Highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_3DHILIGHT
member.summary: Highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.SystemColorIndex.COLOR_BTNHILIGHT
member.summary: Highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source.)

member.name: T:Vanara.InteropServices.AnySizeStringMarshaler`1
member.summary:
A marshaler implementation of to marshal structures whose last field is a character array of length (1) and that uses a field to determine the length of the full string.
Use the cookie paramter of to specify the name of the field in that specifies the length of the string in the last field of along with use indicators.
If the field specifies byte, rather than character length, follow the field name with a colon (:) followed by 'b' (for bytes) or 'c' (for characters).
If the field specifies a length that does NOT include the NULL terminator, follow the field name, colon (:), and type specifier by 'r' (for raw) or 'n' (for null-terminated).
If the field name is "*", then the string length will be determined by the amount of allocated memory.
member.typeparam: The structure type to be marshaled.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.AnySizeStringMarshaler`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:

If the field specifies byte, rather than character length, follow the field name with a colon (:) followed by 'b' (for bytes) or 'c' (for characters).
If the field specifies a length that does NOT include the NULL terminator, follow the field name, colon (:), and type specifier by 'r' (for raw) or 'n' (for null-terminated).

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers.EnumeratorToEnumVariantMarshaler
member.summary: Marshals the COM IEnumVARIANT interface to the .NET Framework interface, and vice versa.
member.remarks: This custom marshaler marshals IEnumVARIANT to and marshals to IEnumVARIANT . The CLR automatically uses this class to bridge COM enumerators and .NET enumerators. The type returned by the GetEnumerator method in the imported COM class uses EnumeratorToEnumVariantMarshaler to map the calls to the IEnumVARIANT interface pointer returned by the COM object's member with a DISPID of -4.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers.EnumeratorToEnumVariantMarshaler.GetInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an instance of the custom marshaler.
member.param: String "cookie" parameter that can be used by the custom marshaler.
member.returns: An instance of the custom marshaler.

member.param: The managed object to be destroyed.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers.EnumeratorToEnumVariantMarshaler.CleanUpNativeData(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Performs necessary cleanup of the unmanaged data when it is no longer needed.
member.param: A pointer to the unmanaged data to be destroyed.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers.EnumeratorToEnumVariantMarshaler.GetNativeDataSize
member.summary: Returns the size in bytes of the unmanaged data to be marshaled.
member.returns: -1 to indicate the type this marshaler handles is not a value type.
